result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Angel Gonzalez

records.addlTxt: Plea date on February 7, 2023 at 01:30 pm.

1:42 pm - Prosecuting attorney Anthony A. Lambrecht appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Angel Gonzalez in court.  Attorney Thomas G Gerleman in court for Angel Gonzalez.  Defendant waives their right to a preliminary hearing.  Defendant is bound over to Circuit Court Branch 2 for trial.  Inducment contained in email dated 07-20-22.
ARRAIGNMENT - 
Information filed.  Copy served on defense counsel.
Not guilty plea(s) entered.  Jury calendar.
Further proceedings scheduled for September 16, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Scheduling conference scheduled for October 19, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Scheduling conference on October 19, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Further proceedings on September 16, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Preliminary hearing on August 3, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

1:39 pm - Prosecuting attorney Gail Ann Prost in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Angel Gonzalez appeared in person.  Attorney Thomas Gerleman appearing in person for defendant. Defendant demands a preliminary hearing.  Defendant waives the statutory time period within which a preliminary hearing must be held. Preliminary hearing is set for 08-03-22 at 1:30 p.m.
Notice of Appointment.  Attorney Thomas Gerleman

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Attorney Thomas Gerleman is appointed as counsel of record.  Defendant is to reimburse the county at a rate of $100.00 per month commencing 06-01-22.

records.descr: Pet for appointment counsel,affidavit of indigency

records.addlTxt:
2:09 pm - Prosecuting attorney Jordan W. Feest in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Angel Gonzalez in court.  Defendant not eligible for public defender. PFAC forms given to defendant in court.
Initial appearance scheduled for May 23, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant requests counsel and is referred to the public defender.   Initial appearance is reset to 04-11-22 at 1:30 p.m.    
Minutes.
Adjourned initial appearance on April 11, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Re:  Possess THC with intent to deliver, on 02-25-22.
Order to report to MTPD for photo and prints

BAIL HEARING - 
Defendant in custody and appearing by video from the Manitowoc County Jail.  The State informs the Court that the defendant will be charged with the crime of possess THC with intent to deliver, possess .  The matter is continued for initial appearance on .  Bail is set at $ recognizance bond with the conditions that he report to the Manitowoc City Police Department Manitowoc County Sheriff's Department for fingerprints, photographs and identifying information within 48 hours or, if incarcerated, within 72 hours of release.  Bail furnished and defendant is released from custody.
Minutes.
